com.github.nirmalpatidar123.anim

Class FlipAnimation

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.animation.Animation
      • com.github.nirmalpatidar123.anim.FlipAnimation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public final class FlipAnimation
extends android.view.animation.Animation
    This class extends Animation to support a 3D flip view transition animation. Two instances of this class is required: one for the "from" view and another for the "to" view. NOTE: use AnimationFactory to use this class.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  FlipAnimation.ScaleUpDownEnum
      This enumeration is used to determine the zoom (or scale) behavior of a FlipAnimation.

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class android.view.animation.Animation

        android.view.animation.Animation.AnimationListener, android.view.animation.Animation.Description

    • Field Detail

      • SCALE_DEFAULT

        public static final float SCALE_DEFAULT
        How much to scale up/down. The default scale of 75% of full size seems optimal based on testing. Feel free to experiment away, however.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • FlipAnimation

        public FlipAnimation(float fromDegrees,
                     float toDegrees,
                     float centerX,
                     float centerY,
                     float scale,
                     FlipAnimation.ScaleUpDownEnum scaleType)
        Constructs a new FlipAnimation object.Two FlipAnimation objects are needed for a complete transition b/n two views.
        Parameters:
        fromDegrees - the start angle in degrees for a rotation along the y-axis, i.e. in-and-out of the screen, i.e. 3D flip. This should really be multiple of 90 degrees.
        toDegrees - the end angle in degrees for a rotation along the y-axis, i.e. in-and-out of the screen, i.e. 3D flip. This should really be multiple of 90 degrees.
        centerX - the x-axis value of the center of rotation
        centerY - the y-axis value of the center of rotation
        scale - to get a 3D effect, the transition views need to be zoomed (scaled). This value must be b/n (0,1) or else the default scale SCALE_DEFAULT is used.
        scaleType - flip view transition is broken down into two: the zoom-out of the "from" view and the zoom-in of the "to" view. This parameter is used to determine which is being done. See FlipAnimation.ScaleUpDownEnum.
